verses.verse: Behold, <WH2009> you are fair, <WH3302> my love; <WH7474> behold, <WH2009> you are fair; <WH3302> you have doves' <WH3123> eyes <WH5869> within <WH1157> your locks: <WH6777> your hair <WH8181> is as a flock <WH5739> of goats, <WH5795> that appear <WH1570> from mount <WH2022> Gilead. <WH1568>

Your teeth <WH8127> are like a flock <WH5739> of sheep that are even shorn, <WH7094> which came <WH5927> up from the washing; <WH7367> whereof every <WH3605> one bear <WH8382> twins, <WH8382> and none <WH369> is barren <WH7909> among them.

Your lips <WH8193> are like a thread <WH2339> of scarlet, <WH8144> and your speech <WH4057> is comely: <WH5000> your temples <WH7541> are like a piece <WH6400> of a pomegranate <WH7416> within <WH1157> your locks. <WH6777>

Your neck <WH6677> is like the tower <WH4026> of David <WH1732> built <WH1129> for an armory, <WH8530> where on <WH5921> there hang <WH8518> a thousand <WH505> bucklers, <WH4043> all <WH3605> shields <WH7982> of mighty <WH1368> men.
Your two <WH8147> breasts <WH7699> are like two <WH8147> young <WH6082> roes <WH6646> that are twins, <WH8380> which feed <WH7462> among the lilies. <WH7799>

Until <WH5704> the day <WH3117> break, <WH6315> and the shadows <WH6752> flee <WH5127> away, I will get <WH3212> me to the mountain <WH2022> of myrrh, <WH4753> and to the hill <WH1389> of frankincense. <WH3828>
You are all <WH3605> fair, <WH3302> my love; <WH7474> there is no <WH369> spot <WH3971> in you.

Come <WH935> with me from Lebanon, <WH3844> my spouse, <WH3618> with me from Lebanon: <WH3844> look <WH7789> from the top <WH7218> of Amana, <WH549> from the top <WH7218> of Shenir <WH8149> and Hermon, <WH2768> from the lions' <WH738> dens, <WH4585> from the mountains <WH2042> of the leopards. <WH5246>

You have ravished <WH3823> my heart, <WH3823> my sister, <WH269> my spouse; <WH3618> you have ravished <WH3823> my heart <WH3823> with one <WH259> of your eyes, <WH5869> with one <WH259> chain <WH6060> of your neck. <WH6677>

How <WH4100> fair <WH3302> is your love, <WH1730> my sister, <WH269> my spouse! <WH3618> how <WH4100> much better <WH2896> is your love <WH1730> than wine! <WH3196> and the smell <WH7381> of your ointments <WH8081> than all <WH3605> spices! <WH1314>

Your lips, <WH8193> O my spouse, <WH3618> drop <WH5197> as the honeycomb: <WH5317> honey <WH1706> and milk <WH2461> are under <WH8478> your tongue; <WH3956> and the smell <WH7381> of your garments <WH8008> is like the smell <WH7381> of Lebanon. <WH3844>
A garden <WH1588> enclosed <WH5274> is my sister, <WH269> my spouse; <WH3618> a spring <WH1530> shut <WH5274> up, a fountain <WH4599> sealed. <WH2856>
Your plants <WH7973> are an orchard <WH6508> of pomegranates, <WH7416> with pleasant <WH4022> fruits; <WH6529> camphire, <WH3724> with spikenard, <WH5373>

Spikenard <WH5373> and saffron; <WH3750> calamus <WH7070> and cinnamon, <WH7076> with all <WH3605> trees <WH6086> of frankincense; <WH3828> myrrh <WH4753> and aloes, <WH174> with all <WH3605> the chief <WH7218> spices: <WH1314>
A fountain <WH4599> of gardens, <WH1588> a well <WH875> of living <WH2416> waters, <WH4325> and streams <WH5140> from Lebanon. <WH3844>

Awake, <WH5782> O north <WH6828> wind; and come, <WH935> you south; <WH8486> blow <WH6315> on my garden, <WH1588> that the spices <WH1314> thereof may flow <WH5140> out. Let my beloved <WH1730> come <WH935> into his garden, <WH1588> and eat <WH398> his pleasant <WH4022> fruits. <WH6529>
